documentation.text: Entry point for new users: acquiring a bot team

Speeds up assignment to new users. 
 This function will crash if it cannot handle all transfers in one single TX
 It is the responsibility of the caller to ensure that the arrays length match correctly

params.playerCreationDay: - days since unix epoch where the player was created as part of teams of a division

encodeTZCountryAndVal(uint8,uint256,uint.details: PlayerId and TeamId both serialize a total of 43 bits:     timeZone        = 5 bits     countryIdxInTZ  = 10 bits     val             = 28 bits (either  (playerIdxInCountry or teamIdxInCountry)*

computeBirthDayAndPotential(uint256,uint.notice: / Compute a random age between 16 and 35.999, with random potential in [0,...7]

computeSkills(uint256,uint8,uint8).notice: / Compute the pseudorandom skills, sum of the skills is 5K (1K each skill on average) / skills have currently, 16bits each, and there are 5 of them / potential is a number between 0 and 9 => takes 4 bit / 0: 000, 1: 001, 2: 010, 3: 011, 4: 100, 5: 101, 6: 110, 7: 111

daysToSecs(uint256).notice: TODO: remove from this contract, expose as interface for users

getOwnerTeamInCountry(uint8,uint256,uint.notice: returns NULL_ADDR if team is bot

initSingleTZ(uint8,uint256).notice: Next function is only used for testing: it inits only one timezone

initTZs(uint256).notice: External Functions Inits all 24 timezones, each with one country, each with one division

nextTimeZoneToUpdate().notice: each day has 24 hours, each with 4 verses => 96 verses per day. day = 0,..13 turnInDay = 0, 1, 2, 3 so for each TZ, we go from (day, turn) = (0, 0) ... (13,3) => a total of 14*4 = 56 turns per tz from these, all map easily to timeZones

setCOO(address).notice: / Setter for main roles: COO, Market owner, Relay owner

timeZoneToUpdatePure(uint256,uint8).notice: tz0  : v = 0, V_DAY, 2 * V_DAY... tzN  : v = 4N + V_DAY * day,  day = 0,...6 tzN  : v = 4N + V_DAY * day,  day = 0,...6  => tzN - tz0 = (v - V_DAY*day)  => 4 tzN = 4 tz0 + v % VERSES_PER_DAY last : v = V_DAY + DELTA + V_DAY * 6  Imagine 2 tzs: 0:00 - tz0; 0:30 - NUL; 1:00 - tz1; 1:30 - tz0; 0:00 - tz0; 0:30 - tz1; So the last

transferFirstBotToAddr(uint8,uint256,add.notice: Entry point for new users: acquiring a bot team

transferFirstBotsToAddresses(uint8[],uin.notice: Speeds up assignment to new users.  This function will crash if it cannot handle all transfers in one single TX It is the responsibility of the caller to ensure that the arrays length match correctly
